title: q18
feedback: The correct answer is: “This story, which is often regarded as semi-autobiographical, may document Gilman’s own post-partum depression.” The subordinate clause “which is often regarded as semi-autobiographical” modifies the word “story.” In the original text, “often regarded as semi-autobiographical” appears to modify “Gilman.” Since a person cannot be semi-autobiographical, this is incorrect. In the choice “Gilman may have documented her own post-partum depression, which is often regarded as semi-autobiographical, in this story,” the phrase appears to modify “depression,” which is also incorrect. “This story often being regarded as semi-autobiographical” is awkward sentence structure.
